Elaboration: The word " begging " in the Jiajin inscription is changed from " qi " to province (Qiu Xigui), " qi " is like the clouds in the sky. Because the sounds of " qi " and " begging " are close, " qi " is used under the guise of begging and begging, but later it is omitted as " begging " to express the meaning of begging. The original meaning is request. Duan Yucai "Shuowen Jiezi Annotation": "Qi, Qi ancient and modern characters. Since the word "qi" is used as the cloud qi word, it is also used as the word "liqi". Qi is the cloud of qi. The extension is the body of qi." To use qi to fake the qi from others, and to save begging." From the oracle bone inscriptions to the Eastern Han Dynasty, " begging " is often written as " qi ". It was only in the Eastern Han Dynasty that " begging " was seen.

The oracle bone inscriptions borrowed as " Zhi ", used as a preposition to express to and to, "Tunnan" 2366: "Qi (begging-Zhi) Japanese wine", " ri " and " wine " are both the names of sacrifices, meaning to the day sacrifice At that time, the wine festival was held.

Bronze inscription means begging, Huanzi Meng Jianghu: "Use Qi (begging) for life", which means praying for good orders.

Han silk book expresses begging, "Mawangdui. Old book before the first volume of Lao Zi. Sixteen Classics. Lines 98-99 of "Guo Tong": "So Guo Tong wears brown clothes and wears it, and she is in harmony (bottle) and ridges (灓). Ying travels (begging) and eats, flows (travels) in the Four Kingdoms, and sees (shows) Poverty practice (low) extreme.” It means that Guotong put on coarse cloth, carried a jar to hold water, walked around, begging for food, and traveled around the countries to show the extreme poverty.

" Begging " later also means giving and supply. "Jiyun‧﹒ "Weiyun": "Begging, and Ye." "Zhengzitong-B": "Begging, where people are also called begging." "Han Shu. Zhu Maichen's Biography: "The wife died on her own, and the buyer begged her husband for money and ordered the burial." This means that the wife hanged herself and the buyer gave her husband money and ordered the burial. Tang Dufu's poem "Zheng Guangwen and Su Siye on the Opera": "Lai You Su Siye always begs for wine." "Begging for wine" means giving money for wine. Representation given to " begging " and indicates that the request is " begging " different tone. Request righteousness, Putonghua is the upper sound, pronounced " Qi ", Cantonese is Yinrusheng, which is pronounced " nucleus "; for the righteousness, both Putonghua and Cantonese are both go sound and pronounced " qi ." Qing Qian Daxin's New Record of "Ten Drivers and Zhai". Begging under the guise of "begging": "Begging and begging are the same word. Take it to enter the sound, and to go."

The meaning of " beg " and "give" in the word " beg " still maintain the pronunciation difference in some Chinese dialects. For example, when the word " beg " in Chaozhou dialect is used as "to take", it is pronounced [khɤk21], such as "beg food", meaning beggar; It is pronounced [khɤʔ21] when it is used as the righteousness of "giving".

humanum_full_description:
甲金文「乞」字由「气」省變而成（裘錫圭），「气」象天上的雲氣。由於「气」、「乞」音近，「气」假借來表示乞求、祈求，後來省作「乞」，專門表示乞求之義。本義是請求。段玉裁《說文解字注》：「气、氣古今字。自以氣爲雲气字，乃又作餼爲廩氣字矣。气本雲气。引伸爲凡气之偁。」「借爲气假於人之气，又省作乞。」由甲骨文至東漢的「乞」常寫作「气」，到東漢才看到「乞」。

　　甲骨文假借為「迄」，用作介詞，表示至、到，《屯南》2366：「气（乞－迄）日酒」，「日」、「酒」都是祭名，意謂到日祭的時候就進行酒祭。

　　金文表示乞求，洹子孟姜壺：「用气（乞）嘉命」，表示因而祈求美好的命令。

　　漢帛書表示乞求，《馬王堆．老子乙本卷前古佚書．十六經．果童》第98-99行：「果童於是衣褐而穿，負并（缾）而巒（灓）。營行气（乞）食，周流（遊）四國，以視（示）貧踐（賤）之極。」意謂果童於是穿上粗布衣，背起瓦缾來盛水，環繞而行，四處乞食，周遊列國，以顯示貧賤到了極點。

　　「乞」後來又有給與、供給的意思。《集韻‧﹒未韻》：「乞，與也。」《正字通‧乙部》：「乞，凡與人物亦曰乞。」《漢書．朱買臣傳》：「妻自經死，買臣乞其夫錢，令葬。」意謂妻子自上吊死了，買臣給錢她的丈夫，命令處理下葬的事。唐杜甫〈戲簡鄭廣文兼呈蘇司業〉詩：「賴有蘇司業，時時乞酒錢。」「乞酒錢」即給予酒錢。表示給予的「乞」和表示請求的「乞」不同音。請求義，普通話是上聲，讀作「啟」，廣州話是陰入聲，讀作「核」的陰聲；給予義，普通話、廣州話都是去聲，讀作「氣」。清錢大昕《十駕齋養新錄．假借乞》：「乞之與乞一字也。取則入聲，與則去聲。」

　　「乞」字的「索取」與「給予」義在一些中國方言中仍保持讀音的差別，如潮州話「乞」字作「索取」時讀［khɤk21］，如「乞食」，義為乞丐；作「給予」義時則讀為［khɤʔ21］，如「本書乞你」，義為這本書給你。

乞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qǐ］
［《廣韻》去訖切，入迄，溪。］
(1)求讨；祈求；请求。
(2)行乞。
(3)索取。见“乞米”。
(4)贫穷。
(5)姓。晋有乞宿云。见《晋书》。
[②]［qì］
［《集韻》丘既切，去未，溪。］
(1)给，给与。
(2)犹被。
(3)始终；一直。
(4)同“气”。气，气味。
(5)同“气”。廪饩，官府供给之食。
